name: Aphrodite
description: Greek goddess of love, beauty, desire, and pleasure. Associated with the sea, roses, and the planet Venus.

name: Ares
description: Greek god of war, courage, and conflict. Associated with strength, martial valor, and the planet Mars.

name: Hermes
description: Greek god of travelers, thieves, merchants, and messengers. Guide of souls to the underworld. Associated with communication and Mercury.

name: Hekate
description: Goddess of magic, witchcraft, the moon, crossroads, and the underworld. Keeper of keys and guardian of thresholds.

name: Persephone
description: Goddess of the underworld and spring. Her journey between worlds embodies themes of transformation, death, and renewal.

name: Apollo
description: God of the sun, music, poetry, prophecy, and healing. Patron of the arts and the oracle at Delphi.

name: Artemis
description: Goddess of the hunt, wilderness, and the moon. Protector of women, children, and wild creatures.

name: Athena
description: Goddess of wisdom, strategic warfare, crafts, and civilization. Patron of Athens and emblem of just leadership.

name: Poseidon
description: God of the sea, earthquakes, and horses. Master of the deep waters and forces of nature.

name: Zeus
description: King of the Olympian gods, ruler of sky and thunder. Associated with authority, justice, and leadership.

name: Dionysus
description: God of wine, ecstasy, theater, and fertility. Embodies the liberating power of altered states and creative madness.

name: Hephaestus
description: God of the forge, fire, and craftsmanship. Master craftsman and maker of divine weapons and tools.

name: Demeter
description: Goddess of grain, harvest, and the fertile earth. Her grief at Persephone's abduction brings winter to the world.

name: Eros
description: Primordial god of love and desire. Embodiment of creative and erotic love that moves through all of existence.

name: Isis
description: Great Egyptian goddess of magic, healing, and motherhood. Powerful magician and devoted protector of the vulnerable.

name: Osiris
description: Egyptian god of the afterlife, resurrection, and agriculture. His story of death and rebirth embodies transformative cycles.

name: Thoth
description: Egyptian god of writing, knowledge, magic, and the moon. Keeper of sacred records and master of occult wisdom.

name: Anubis
description: Egyptian god of the dead and embalming. Guide of souls through the afterlife and guardian of tombs.

name: Ra
description: Egyptian sun god and king of the gods. His daily journey across the sky represents the triumph of light over darkness.

name: Bastet
description: Egyptian cat goddess of protection, joy, and the home. Associated with feminine power, sensuality, and guardian energy.

name: Sekhmet
description: Lioness goddess of war, fire, and healing. She embodies both destruction and the power to heal great wounds.

name: Hathor
description: Egyptian goddess of love, beauty, music, and motherhood. Embodies joy, abundance, and celestial love.

name: Ma'at
description: Egyptian goddess of truth, justice, and cosmic order. Her feather weighs against the heart of the deceased.

name: Nephthys
description: Egyptian goddess of death, night, and mourning. Sister of Isis and companion of the dead.

name: Odin
description: Allfather of the Norse gods. God of wisdom, war, poetry, and magic. Seeker of hidden knowledge at great personal cost.

name: Freyja
description: Norse goddess of love, beauty, war, and seidr magic. Leader of the Valkyries and keeper of the dead.

name: Thor
description: Norse god of thunder, strength, and protection of humanity. Wielder of Mjolnir, the divine hammer.

name: Loki
description: Norse trickster god of change and transformation. Shape-shifter who catalyzes necessary chaos and creative upheaval.

name: Frigg
description: Norse queen of the gods, goddess of marriage, motherhood, and foresight. Weaver of fate and keeper of hearth.

name: Tyr
description: Norse god of law, justice, and righteous combat. He sacrificed his hand to bind Fenrir for the good of all.

name: Baldur
description: Norse god of light, beauty, and purity. His death and eventual return symbolize the cycles of light and rebirth.

name: Hel
description: Norse ruler of the realm of the dead. Daughter of Loki who governs those who die of illness, old age, or natural causes.

name: The Morrígan
description: Irish triple goddess of fate, war, and sovereignty. Shapeshifter who appears as crow, wolf, and eel. Prophetess of battle outcomes.

name: Brigid
description: Irish goddess of healing, poetry, and the forge. Associated with Imbolc, her sacred flame is tended continuously.

name: Cernunnos
description: Celtic horned god of nature, wild animals, and the cycle of life. Master of the forest and the liminal spaces between worlds.

name: Lugh
description: Irish god of the sun, skill, and craftsmanship. Patron of all arts and the harvest festival of Lughnasadh.

name: Inanna
description: Sumerian goddess of love, war, justice, and political power. Her descent and return from the underworld is among humanity's oldest myths.

name: Kali
description: Hindu goddess of time, destruction, and liberation. Her fierce aspect dissolves ego and illusion, freeing the soul.

name: Lakshmi
description: Hindu goddess of wealth, fortune, and beauty. She embodies auspiciousness and is celebrated at Diwali.

name: Saraswati
description: Hindu goddess of knowledge, music, the arts, and wisdom. Patron of learning and eloquence.

name: Ganesha
description: Hindu elephant-headed deity of beginnings and removal of obstacles. Invoked at the start of any important undertaking.

name: Shiva
description: Hindu god of destruction and transformation. The destroyer of ego and illusion who makes way for new creation.

name: Durga
description: Hindu warrior goddess and protector. Her fierce power defeats demons and protects the righteous.

name: Archangel Michael
description: Prince of the heavenly armies and chief of the archangels. Associated with protection, truth, and divine justice.

name: Archangel Gabriel
description: The divine messenger archangel. Associated with communication, revelation, purification, and new beginnings.

name: Archangel Raphael
description: The healing archangel. Oversees physical and emotional healing, travel, and spiritual guidance.

name: Archangel Uriel
description: Angel of wisdom and illumination. Associated with the earth, natural forces, and bringing divine light to darkness.

name: Metatron
description: Highest of the angels in Kabbalistic tradition. Scribe of God and mediator between the divine and human realms.

name: Bune
description: 72nd spirit of the Goetia, appearing as a three-headed dragon. Associated with wealth, eloquence, and communication with the departed.

name: Dantalion
description: 71st spirit of the Goetia. Depicted with many faces. Associated with knowledge of thoughts, influencing minds, and hidden wisdom.

name: Sallos
description: 19th spirit of the Goetia. Said to promote love between men and women and to bring peace between adversaries.

name: Marbas
description: 5th spirit of the Goetia. Associated with healing, knowledge of hidden things, and mechanical arts.

name: The Dark Knight Archetype
description: Archetypal figure of the wounded protector who channels grief and trauma into fierce justice and nocturnal vigilance.

name: The Jedi Archetype
description: Archetypal figure of the mindful warrior who balances the inner light and shadow. Embodies discipline, service, and the Force.

name: The Brilliant Witch Archetype
description: Archetypal figure of the studious magical practitioner who combines intellect, empathy, and fierce loyalty in service of good.

name: The Wise Mage Archetype
description: Archetypal figure of the ancient, wandering wizard who guides others through darkness toward their greatest potential.

name: Obatala
description: Orisha of purity, clarity, and creation. Father of all Orishas and molder of human bodies, associated with white, wisdom, and peaceful authority.

name: Yemaya
description: Orisha of the ocean and motherhood. Nurturing protector of women and children, governing the depths of the sea and the mysteries of life.

name: Shango
description: Orisha of thunder, lightning, and justice. Embodies fierce power, passion, and kingship. Patron of warriors and those who seek strength.

name: Ogun
description: Orisha of iron, labor, and war. Patron of blacksmiths, hunters, and warriors, governing all things made of iron and the clearing of obstacles.

name: Eshu
description: Orisha of crossroads, communication, and chance. Messenger between the divine and human realms, opener of paths and guardian of thresholds.

name: Oshun
description: Orisha of rivers, love, fertility, and prosperity. Embodiment of feminine sweetness, beauty, and abundance. Governs fresh water and matters of the heart.

name: Ifá
description: Orisha of wisdom and divination. The body of knowledge and divine oracle through which the Orishas communicate fate and guidance to humanity.

name: Oya
description: Orisha of winds, storms, and transformation. Guardian of the cemetery and the passage between life and death, embodying radical change and fierce feminine power.

name: Orunmila
description: Orisha of knowledge, fate, and divination. Witness to all creation, Orunmila embodies the highest wisdom of the Ifá oracle and guides souls toward their destiny.
